intro: Deeringia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower deeringia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate to lance-shaped with a dense covering of hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Deeringia densiflora is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
